channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: DC mayor fires back at House Oversight Committee over 'politically motivated' crime statistics report
item.description: D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser slams House Oversight Committee report on crime statistics as "politically motivated," defends outgoing police chief.

item.title: You can make up to $200K working in Trump’s new ‘Tech Force’—and you don’t need a degree or work experience
item.description: To be eligible for the two-year program, you only need "strong problem-solving abilities and a passion for public service."​

item.title: The Federalist’s Notable Books Of 2025
item.description: Seasons greetings! It's time for another exciting and sprawling books recommendation column.

item.title: Donald Trump Jr., Bettina Anderson announce engagement at White House holiday party
item.description: The announcement of Donald Trump Jr. and Palm Beach socialite Bettina Anderson's engagement rang through the White House walls Monday night.

item.title: Australia’s Dangerous Naïveté
item.description: The atrocity at Bondi Beach was heartrending and all too predictable.

item.title: No Heroes in the Oklahoma Grading Controversy
item.description: There’s only one relevant question in a University of Oklahoma probe into a failing grade that became a national story.

item.title: Wisconsin Supreme Court Ends Democrat AG’s Bid To ‘Defy’ SCOTUS’ Catholic Charity Ruling
item.description: 'You’d think Wisconsin would take a 9-0 Supreme Court loss as a hint to stop digging,' said Becket Fund attorney Eric Rassbach.

item.title: Judge Rules Wisconsin Show Trial Against Trump Allies Will Go On
item.description: Far-left Attorney General Brad Kaul brought charges against three defendants in what many see as a proxy trial aimed at President Trump.

item.title: Trump has ‘an alcoholic’s personality, chief of staff says in wide-ranging Vanity Fair interview. She calls it a ‘hit piece’
item.description: Susie Wiles also told Vanity Fair that she has read the Epstein file and that Trump is “not in the file doing anything awful.”

item.title: Obamas planned to meet Reiners on night they were killed, former first lady reveals
item.description: Michelle Obama reveals on "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" that she and Barack were supposed to meet Rob and Michele Reiner the very night they tragically died.

item.title: ‘But Your iPhone’ Conservatism Will Fail
item.description: We must acknowledge that the badges of middle-class life have become harder to achieve, no matter our technological advances.

item.title: Unemployment hits 4-year high as frozen jobs data shows recession risks getting ‘uncomfortably high,’ top economist Mark Zandi says
item.description: Payroll growth for November came in at a modest 64,000. “There’s just no forward motion,” Moody’s chief economist told Fortune.

item.title: Government belatedly reveals loss of 105,000 jobs in October as full DOGE cutbacks come into view
item.description: Both the October and November job creation numbers, released Tuesday by the Labor Department, came in late because of the 43-day government shutdown.

item.title: Jimmy Lai’s Criminal Conviction Is What Democracy Dying In Darkness Actually Looks Like
item.description: Jimmy Lai's courage is something America's propaganda media could only dream of possessing.
